executable.title: Brain Logistic Segmentation
executable.description: This is a CLI module that provides the Brain Logistic Segmentation (BLS) algorithm, which offer a simple and fast alternative to CSF, gray and white matter tissues segmentation. The entire module are optmized to strucutral MRI brain images, such as T1, T2 and PD weighted images. Although BLS algorithm was intensivelly studied on T1 images, the further application on other imaging modalitites are expected to behave in a similar robustness (if those images maintain the basic features needed). The full algorithm explanation and benchmark are explained in details at: DOI

image.name: inputVolume
image.label: Input Volume
image.description: Input volume (T1, T2 or PD MRI images)

image.name: outputTissue
image.label: Output Tissue
image.description: Output Tissues. A binary mask with all the tissues being represented

integer.name: nTissues
integer.label: Number Of Tissues
integer.description: The number of tissues presented in the input image. This should be driven by the image histogram peaks.

boolean.name: doOneTissue
boolean.description: Choose this if you want a single tissue as the output mask.
boolean.label: Extract one single tissue

integer.name: selectedTissueMask
integer.label: Selected Tissue Mask
integer.description: Select what tissue that should be exported. Here the order is always given from the brightest to darkest tissue. For instance, for T1 images, the white matter is 1, gray matter is 2 and CSF is 3.

float.name: tissueThr
float.label: Tissue Refinement Threshold
float.description: Defines the logistic classification threshold that should be adopted in order to define the binary mask. If thr=0.5, all the tissues are precisely added without any ovarlay. If thr<0.5, there is a tissue mask overlay representing the parcial volume (PV) among tissues, which is placed in an additional tissue mask (PV masking). If thr>0.5, the overlay is also presented regarind PV, however the output is changed to zero, i.e. the overlay tissue is not represented as an additional mask.

boolean.name: useManualBins
boolean.description: Choose if you want to set the number of bins manually.
boolean.label: Use Manual Number Of Bins
